attributes.action: Completely change the old system of education we have today.
attributes.background: Uk needs a modern integral education based on the talents and abilities of students; so that when they finish secondary they know three languages and have a defined job. Children 0-6 years will learn playing, 7-11 years will learn practicing at school, 12-16 years will learn practicing in companies.
attributes.additional_details: The education be taught with computers and practices they will be guided by specialized teachers in each area; so that at years a child will be in the ability to program a computer and at 12 years he will have a profession. With the new system of education in the 21st century; let's educate for entrepreneurs to be those that produce jobs and not like the old traditional education, which teaches to create simple employees. We are going to take advantage of the new technologies and scientific advances to integrally educated and with high quality our children, who are the future of the Nation.

attributes.action: take alcohol off display in shops like cigarettes and no advertising
attributes.background:
Alcohol-related crime in the UK is estimated to cost between £8bn and £13bn per year.
A fifth (29%) of all violent incidents in 2013–14 took place in or around a pub or club. ...
attributes.additional_details: There were 8,270 casualties of drink driving accidents in the UK in 2013, including 240 fatalities and 1,100 people who suffered serious injury.

attributes.action: Introduce a new and robust system of dealing with judicial misconduct
attributes.background: The rules which govern judicial misconduct exclude any decisions made by a judge in the course of proceedings. For example, the personal decisions of judges knowingly and purposively to falsify a claim or to make misleading records in court documents are all classified as "judicial decisions".
attributes.additional_details: The rules do not distinguish between judicial case management and judicial case manipulation. Judicial misconduct is now defined as little more than rudeness.  A judicial decision is now almost any personal decision made by a judge in  court. There is no constituted body which ensures everyone's basic right to a fair and public hearing by an independent and impartial tribunal, or the right to an honest, accurate and unbiased record or that judges must be impartial and seen to be impartial.

attributes.action: The import and personal use of DMT-containing plant materials should be legal.
attributes.background: While the Psychoactive Substances Act 2016 is right to ban some dangerous legal highs, a blanket ban is ill-considered. Personal use and import of DMT-containing plant materials, in their natural form, should be legal, especially since the possession of said item is NOT a crime under this new act.
attributes.additional_details:
Certain plants and plant materials found in nature have long been used for curing depression, learning about consciousness and developing spirituality for those who find religion ineffective. Plants used for 'Ayahuasca' have powerful healing properties and have been used by many to help overcome depression, anxiety and stress. Personal use can allow people to study spirituality, the nature of our existence and consciousness as a right of their freedom.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ayahuasca

attributes.action: Introduce a bill to set a higher minimum wage for zero hours contracts
attributes.background:
We call on the government to introduce a bill to set a higher minimum wage for hours worked above contract hours. This would set a higher minimum pay rate for zero hour/minimal hours contracts.

Hours worked above contracted hours the minimum pay rate must be at least 1.25 times the minimum wage.
attributes.additional_details:
The aim of this bill is to target employers who systemically provide employees with contracts for considerably fewer hours than they would normally be expected to work. The most extreme case of this is employers who widely use zero hours contracts.

In the example of a zero hours contract the minimum pay rate would be £9 per hour based on the current National Living Wage of £7.20. The same minimum rate would apply to other overtime.

attributes.action: Change The General Election Voting System From FPTP To Instant-Runoff Voting
attributes.background: Hello, I am Emmanuel and I am 13 years old and came across a video on YouTube that displayed how bad the first past the post voting system is. In its simplest form FPTP is basically winner takes all. In the general election the Conservatives won 36.9% of the votes but they have 100% of the power.
attributes.additional_details:
I want to change the the the general election voting system from FPTP to IRV because in IRV there is definitely a majority winner so most people who vote will at least be moderately happy.

This YouTube video explains how bad FPTP is: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s7tWHJfhiyo

This YouTube video explains how much better IRV is: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Y3jE3B8HsE

attributes.action: Suspend wage reviews for senior civil servants until after brexit negotiations
attributes.background: Civil servants shouldn't need motivating to do their job of backing British interests but unfortunately they have been so intermingled with the EU for so long. They could be inclined to drag thing's out hoping for a new Pro EU government or a second referendum.
attributes.additional_details: So I suggest halting all senior service pay a promotion reviews until after the brexit process has been completed with a cut off date of 2019 a full year before the next generation election. Then the retrospective senior service reviews will be based on past brexit performance not a half hearted effort of the reluctant

attributes.action: help with more funding for veterans with PTSD and family's
attributes.background: Currently change step have been denied extra funding to carry on providing a mentoring service for veterans suffering PTSD and families, by losing this much needed service, this could have a negative impact on the mental health issues of veterans,
attributes.additional_details:
Change Step, based in Colwyn Bay, Conwy county, said 29 workers would lose their jobs following an unsuccessful bid for further funding.
The charity said it was still "determined to carry on".
The Ministry of Defence, which awarded the charity £995,918 in 2013, said it could apply for further funding "in the coming months and years".

attributes.action: start a national lottery to run health service
attributes.background: save our health service

attributes.action: Stop NHS denying help for eating disorders on grounds patients are "too complex"
attributes.background: As someone who personally suffers from an eating disorder, I have been lucky to receive adequate treatment to recover. However, for a number of people who suffer and want to recover, particularly those who need admitting as an inpatient, some are told they are "too complex" for treatment.
attributes.additional_details: Due to lack of mental health beds, and NICE guidelines stipulating special requirements for the treatment of eating disorders, some patients are being told they are "too complex" to receive treatment at the present time, even though they are willing to recover in an inpatient setting. Due to the guidelines and shortage of beds, those with eating disorders are slipping through the cracks of the system, and this is allowing for needless deaths that could have been prevented.

attributes.action: Make ALL schools teach kids the dangers of the railway.
attributes.background:
We all know that the railway is a dangerous place, however people still do not understand this and are running across the tracks at stations, laying on the tracks or even playing chicken at level crossings.

Last year 332 people died after trespassing onto the railway tracks in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Now kids think it's right to play on the railway and ignore all the safety rules displayed around the tracks. 

If schools teach kids that it's dangerous to play on or around the railway then the figures might go down and there will be less deaths.

attributes.action: Introduce a "safe for the road" certification system for both riders and horses.
attributes.background: Horses are large animals and potentially dangerous on the roads, especially  to pedestrians and cyclists. The level of rider skill, and the temperament of the animals is enormously varied. Most horse riders are able and considerate but a significant minority are not.

attributes.action: Co-ordinate a crowdfund of Tata Steel interests in the UK.
attributes.background: The UK is in danger of losing it's Steel industry due to the commercial viability for it's owners, Tata Steel. It is my petition that the UK government negotiate a scrap/asset disposal price from Tata, prepare a crowd-funding campaign for the acquisition and management of these assets.
attributes.additional_details: Furthermore, the crowdfunding campaign should look to raise sufficient additional funds to give a minimum 2 year safety net for the continuation of the business based upon projected revenue streams. For more information on how to support the campaign further please get your friends, employer and any wealthy individuals that you are connected with to visit myopinionpal.com where any funds raised will be used to get more people to support this petition.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for smart meters to work regardless of supplier
attributes.background: I phoned B Gas and requested to change our gas meter to a smart meter. They stated that unless I bring my electricity to them they can't provide a smart meter. They further stated that if I change the supplier at any time the smart meter will not function due to their accounting system.
attributes.additional_details: All accounting systems are now universal and I feel the Select Committee should question British Gas. Why do they insist on customers bringing their electric supply and not install a smart meter for gas supply only for which they are supplier to the property? It is a very serious issue and I humbly request the Chairman of the Select Committee to question British Gas. I do want a Smart Meter installed without any conditions attached. There is clear indication of the MONOPOLY for energy supply.

attributes.action: Make retesting of all road users compulsory every 5 years to ensure road safety.
attributes.background: With road deaths increased in 2014 by 4% from 2013 to 1775, serious road injuries increasing by 5% in 2014 from 2013 to 22807 and the total of 194,477 casualties of all severities in reported road traffic accidents during 2014 retesting of road users is essential to protecting the roads.
attributes.additional_details: http://tinyurl.com/nkzmbzh shows the evidence. What is proposed is that road users be charged for the retest. If they pass the test they are refunded the entire test fee as they are competent, if they fail they revert to a provisional licence and have to retrain similar to learners. This makes roads safer (priority), increases employment within the DVSA (better for workforce), provides additional income source which can be put on improving the road network in the UK. Winners all round.

attributes.action: Stop the NHS defunding IVF Treatment and make it equal no matter where you live
attributes.background: The NHS is planning to look at cutting funding to IVF treatments. This is while still allowing people to have cosmetic treatments like tattoo removal for free. People who meet the criteria and have followed guidelines deserve to have this treatment no matter where they live. Stop postcode lottery.

attributes.action: Introduce a new 'National Health Tax' which is only to be used for NHS.
attributes.background: Most people in the UK seem to be happy with paying extra to fund the NHS. An new NHT would target funds directly to where they are needed and not form part of a central pot. NHT could be applied to the following: Petrol and diesel, Alcohol, tobacco, UK visitors at port of entry (£25.00) etc
attributes.additional_details:
NHT would be in addition to VAT but NOT be applied to direct income.
For example current VAT at 20% could be raised to 21% to include 1% NHT. The government could no longer be blamed for not having enough cash as the NHT would be a disclosed figure and allocated directly. We should also reduce grants to the FA and other organisations not in need and reduce overseas aid. This saving can be converted as an NHT income.

attributes.action: Change the law that states you have to do 3 sciences for GCSE.
attributes.background: I am a 12 year old girl. have just chosen my GCSE's and I think it is wrong that I have to do 3 sciences. I think we should change the law so it is that we have to do 2 sciences and then have the choice to do 1 more science or a different subject.
attributes.additional_details: The law currently states that GCSE students have to do all 3 sciences and the reasoning for this is that there needs to be more women in scientific jobs. This law does not help those who do not want to have a career in science. I think that the law should be changed so that GCSE students do 2 sciences and then chose either 1 more science or a different subject. This means you are not losing a GCSE or a qualification, just possibly a science.

attributes.action: Student maintenance loans to include parental outgoings as well as incomings
attributes.background: When a student applies for a maintenance loan through Student Finance UK, they have to declare their total annual household income. Whilst this may be effective for the upper and lower class, many of the middle class families lose out substantially.
attributes.additional_details: With a maximum loan of 8,200 for students with an annual household income of less than £25,000, no financial aid is expected of their parents or guardians. However, despite a student turning 18, being a separate legal entity to their parents or guardians, parents are expected to help despite their outgoings. Annual household incomes over £62,177 allow students to be entitled to a £3,821 loan. With accomodation nearly always over this amount, parents are expected to help to the extent of £5,000.

attributes.action: Establish a mandatory retirement age of 2 years for UK Beagles in Animal Testing
attributes.background: Beagles one of the most intelligent loving dogs around  were forced to inhale cigarette smoke in the 70s and in labs are still subjected to live in tiny cages and forced to inhale weed- killers, pesticides and other toxic substances. In California a bill has been passed and can the UK do the same?
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.express.co.uk/news/world/476866/WATCH-Freed-beagles-play-outside-for-the-first-time

http://www.onegreenplanet.org/news/bill-that-requires-labs-to-retire-cats-and-dogs-from-testing-passed-in-california/

attributes.action: Ban the sale of cats except from registered breeders.
attributes.background: The stray cat population is out of control. Sale of cats should be restricted to registered breeders who neuter and meet animal welfare standards.

attributes.action: Create public bonds that pension funds etc' can invest to build owned homes too.
attributes.background: The recent addition of bonds to enable buy-to-let creation doesn't help facilitate a proper meritocracy. More proper for a 50-50 split in terms of building policy choice. This policy seems like a government giving up on the future of truly independent living to appease the big house builders.
attributes.additional_details: We know that the big 5 housing companies are holding onto roughly 476,000 planning permissions, artificially inflating housing prices and have been doing so for decades. I say this policy is just as monopolistic in tendency as the recent energy, rail ticketing and Fifa bribes scandals. This isn't about morals, this is about conservative Hayek based free-market systems. Unfortunately, a state sponsored 'eye' is required to help maintain proper market function from time to time.

attributes.action: STOP THE BAN ON MENTHOL CIGARETTES
attributes.background:
Menthol cigarettes are about to become illegal.

Under new tobacco laws, menthol flavour in cigarettes will be phased out over the next four years – ready for a complete ban on May 20, 2020.
attributes.additional_details: As a smoker trying to cut down I've found menthol cigarettes to be a stepping stone to cut down to around 5 cigarettes a day from around 30. With the withdrawal of menthol cigarettes people will turn to illegal ways to get hold of them. Crime and costs for the government will rocket. Also people won't have an effective way to stop so problems will get worse. Also cigarettes will be no longer sold in packs of ten so this will encourage harsher smoking and will cost more on the NHS. STOP THE BAN

attributes.action: Abolish all speed limits on the M6 toll road
attributes.background: The M6 toll road is a private road and road users have to pay to use it. The police should have no authority to generate funds from drivers who ignore the 70mph limit as hello this is a private road.

attributes.action: Stop the sale of local phone numbers to National or non local businesses.
attributes.background: People are being deceived into thinking they're calling a local tradesperson because they call a local number in their local paper, when in reality they are being diverted elsewhere without knowing it.
attributes.additional_details: Recently an 82 year old woman called what she thought was a friendly neighbourhood business and ended up getting ripped off to the tune of £138 and the company which was over 200 miles away refused to put it right, this is one of many examples of this.

attributes.action: Wages to be tax free for 1 month every year.
attributes.background: I earn an average wage and when it comes to pay day I still struggle with outgoings especially around Christmas time. I always find myself looking at my pay slip wishing that I could have 100% of the money that I worked hard to make, this is one of many reasons why I have started this petition.
attributes.additional_details: The average salary for 2016/17 in the UK is around £28,000, the person earning this salary will only see around £22,000 of it. To some people this may or may not be a lot of money but regardless of whether you think it is or not, that person worked hard to earn this money. Our contributions are not voluntary but they make a very big difference to our country which is why I believe we deserve at least 1 month in a year where our wages is tax free.

attributes.action: Start a Hate Offender's Register,  modelled on the Sex Offender's Register.
attributes.background: Parents should have the right to know if their child runs the risk of being bullied or radicalised by hate preachers in their neighbourhood. A register of hate offenders will empower subjects of Her Majesty to make informed choices on who they may wish to avoid to keep safe and avoid conflict.

attributes.action: Greater punishment for drivers convicted of drug or alcohol offences
attributes.background: Laws already allow for higher alcohol consumption in the UK than in many other countries and yet we allow offenders to face very limited actions or penalties for what is a serious offence. Repeat offenders see no consequence for their actions regardless of if they injure or kill anyone.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2014 for example between 220 and 260 people were killed in Great Britain where at least 1 driver was over the drink drive limit
The total number of casualties of all types in drink drive accidents is 8,210. 
2015 show there were between 200 and 290 deaths in drink drive accidents AN INCREASE ON THE PREVIOUS YEAR

attributes.action: Remove the NHS from party politics
attributes.background: Remove the NHS from party politics. Consider an option similar to an independent non-political NHS committee that will be responsible for the budget and running of the NHS. Often the NHS is a political football and used to gain seats in elections. It needs to be run independently outside of politics
attributes.additional_details: When it comes to the day-to-day running of the NHS, the role of national politics should be significantly reduced.

attributes.action: Force large landowners to increase afforestation to stop flooding downstream
attributes.background: The risk of flooding in lowland areas is currently been increased by large landowners increasing the level of drainage and not increasing the percentage of land covered by woodland. Increases in woodland would both reduce the speed and  water levels reaching watercourses and preventing flooding.
attributes.additional_details: Flooding in low lying areas is caused by four main factors: precipitation levels, level of development on floodplains, speed of water reaching local watercourses and amount reaching watercourses. This petition is trying to encourage legislation in two of these four factors: speed and amount of water reaching local watercourses. Watersheds need vast increases in woodland to slow down water speeds through the leaves of trees, soil saturation and vegetation using water resources.

attributes.action: all state visits to be approved by parliament before an invite is given.
attributes.background: to avoid the situation the country is in regarding the trump state visit

attributes.action: MPs must have a vote on our proposed deal before reaching the EU parliament.
attributes.background: We must give our MPs the right to scrutinise the deal we're offering BEFORE the European parliament. We must show unity as a nation when going about Brexit talks and show the entire EU that any deal we proposed is back by Westminster.

attributes.action: Make it so students can choose a certain method for exams.
attributes.background: Make it so that students can take one of four options for exams at A-level and GCSE: Written, Vocal, Coursework base or practical in as many subjects as possible and the student can decide what type of examination method they want to be tested by.

attributes.action: Make Holocaust denial illegal in the UK
attributes.background: In a number of European countries Holocaust denial is an illegal practice including Germany, Austria, Belgium and France. To deny the Holocaust is to deny the suffering of millions and minimise the gross wrongs done against Jewish, disabled, homosexual and non-white people in the 1930s/40s.
attributes.additional_details: In Germany the law states: "(3) Whosoever publicly or in a meeting approves of, denies or downplays an act committed under the rule of National Socialism of the kind indicated in section 6 (1) of the Code of International Criminal Law, in a manner capable of disturbing the public peace shall be liable to imprisonment not exceeding five years or a fine." This is the type of ruling I believe should be put in place in the UK.

attributes.action: Integrate reCAPTCHA so signatures are legitimate rather than bot scripted.
attributes.background: If media agencies are going to quote the numbers of signatories as being indicative of public support then this website needs to do more to ensure that bots can't sign it. Using Google's free reCAPTCHA service would be a simple way of stripping out the vast majority of bots.

attributes.action: Ban Employers from rejecting applicants without giving feedback.
attributes.background: I woulf like to see the government prevent Employers rejecting candidates particularly after and interview without giving feedback on where sed candidate went wrong.
attributes.additional_details:
"Thank you for taking part in the recent assessment for the position of Online Driver.

While you demonstrated some of the skills we’re looking for, after careful consideration we regret to inform you that you have been unsuccessful"  Thank you for taking part in the recent assessment for the position of Online Driver.

While you demonstrated some of the skills we’re looking for, after careful consideration we regret to inform you that you have been unsuccessful Something like this isnt helpful.

attributes.action: Add 1p tax on all cartons/bottles/packet sold - money used to clean our streets
attributes.background: Our cities are getting filthier because of the litter, even our countryside is now suffering badly. Councils find it ever harder to deal with this issue with budgetary restraints, particularly in rural areas. Adding 1p to an item will not add much to its cost but could have a very positive effect.
attributes.additional_details: I recently walked two miles of a country lane and collected 28 black bags of plastic and cans! We are sinking in rubbish. A 1p levy on each item (multi packs - 12 pack would pay 12p more) would raise a huge amount of money and could be granted to local councils 'ring fenced' to pay for new employees to clean up the problem.

attributes.action: Declare the Tube an essential service and force unions into compulsory mediation
attributes.background: Tube strikes have been paralyzing London for years for all kinds of reasons. The battle between the unions and TfL management leave the public in the lurch, suffering through queues and bringing roads to a standstill. They do great damage to economy, emergency services and environment.
attributes.additional_details: Compulsory mediation would force both parties to the negotiating table and to achieve a fair outcome through mediation by an independent third party. Strikes are avoided and the public is not harmed by abstract, arcane industrial disputes.

attributes.action: Declare smoking in public areas a criminal offence
attributes.background: Smoking is a choice and no-one should be punished for the choices of another. Smoking should be made illegal in public areas to assist non-smokers who do not wish to be in contact with the toxic fumes of second-hand smoke.
attributes.additional_details: Everyone's needed to walk past someone smoking in public and needing to hold their breath to avoid inhaling the toxic fumes. Every year, second-hand smoke kills thousands of people in the UK from lung cancer, heart disease, strokes and the lung disease COPD. Second-hand smoke has been linked to around 165,000 new cases of disease among children in the UK each year. Passive smoking may also increase the risk of cancers of the larynx and pharynx.

attributes.action: A child born of British parent(s) shall not require a visa to enter/live in UK.
attributes.background: In line with the Human Rights of Children.

attributes.action: Install adequately bright street-lighting on all stretches of all UK highways.
attributes.background:
Driving on motorways or on any roads during nighttime can be extremely difficult when the roads are not adequately lit up.
This problem is more severe during the winter period when the nights are longer, darker and prone to complicated weather conditions.
attributes.additional_details:
The amount of drivers using the roads of Great Britain is expanding constantly and the issue of desperately required lighting on all stretches of highways during night hours, which affects millions on a daily, or nightly, basis must be urgently addressed.
This urgent matter affects motorways and all grades of well used roads.

attributes.action: Ban vans from the third lane of motorways
attributes.background: I find that as vans have become much more sporty they often use the second overtaking lane of motorways. If you are driving a car or motorcycle in this lane and a van pulls out in front of you, you can't see through or round it.
attributes.additional_details: This is from personal experience and talking to friends and colleagues

attributes.action: Share all the steps of Brexit with the public on a weekly basis.
attributes.background: This petition is not asking for change to a particular matter, rather simply requesting that all decisions, new deals, or any other steps taken on in the negotiations during the procedure of Brexit, be shared with the public before they finalized.
attributes.additional_details:
Nothing in history comes remotely close to the change that will happen when Brexit actually happens in full force.

And 90% of us will be affected in one way or another. 

Therefore we ask the government to give the people who voted for this, and who voted the people in government, knowledge of every deal, decision or law as they are taken on, step by step.

attributes.action: Capital gains tax should be levied on the sale of second homes.
attributes.background: The housing crisis is being exacerbated by the out of control practice of residential property being traded as a capital gains tax free investment. Every aspect of UK society would benefit by a capital gains tax being levied on the sale of all second homes.

attributes.action: Stop outstanding council tax debt being passed onto Debt collection agencies.
attributes.background:
Stop outstanding council tax debt being passed onto Debt collection agencies and Bailffs.
If anyone in the UK has or is experiencing any kind of financial difficulties then passing the debt to any Debt collection agency or Bailffs incur extra cost to which adds extra stress and anxiety.

attributes.action: Debate possibility that the "Peoples Will" has changed since Scotland Referendum
attributes.background:
In 2014 the Scottish public voted to Remain a part of the UK and it is increasingly evident that the full implications were not considered regarding Remain in the run-up to the referendum. 

Numerous polls suggest there would now be a clear majority to Leave.
attributes.additional_details: Any such debate should be before any Brexit implications debate as this referendum was in 2014 and the EU Leave/Remain vote was in 2016.

attributes.action: Abolish VAT and instead increase corporation tax
attributes.background:
VAT stunts growth of SME's

Raising tax based on profits would encourage enterprise and encourage and help businesses of all sizes to grow.

attributes.action: Points removed by DVLA should be erased by insurance companies at the same time.
attributes.background: Insurance companies hold on to points which have been removed by the DVLA for an extra year and are pumping up the price of insurance or refusing insurance altogether. I believe this is legalised theft and totally unfair.
attributes.additional_details: On 21st December 2012, I got caught without insurance by a technicality: I believed that I was insured but had missed a payment,  unknown to me Ellephant Insurance cancelled it without telling me. My payday was the next day and I had plans to pay then anyway so I would have found out. As a result I got an in 10.  6 points which stay on the licence for 4 years pumping up car insurance by lots and lots of money. (I STILL BELIEVE IT WAS NOT MY FAULT).  So 4 years have passed and still my car insurance is sky high as all the insurance companies keep it on record and used it against us for an extra year. THIS IS WRONG! THIS MUST CHANGE NOW!

attributes.action: Recall the UK ambassador to the USA in protest against the travel ban
attributes.background: On 27 January 2017, the U.S. President signed an executive order banning all entry of people from seven muslim-majority countries. This includes refugees, holders of visas and green cards, and current. U.S. residents. The UK should officially recall its ambassador to the US in protest.
attributes.additional_details: The executive order signed by U.S. President Donald Trump and its consequences have been widely covered in the press. Many people currently travelling but living in the USA are suddenly separated from their loved ones, including refugees. The order is officially motivated by "anti-terrorism" but does not make anybody safer anywhere, no national from any listed country has commited terrorism on US soil. The UK must send the clearest possible signal of disapproval by recalling the US ambassador.

attributes.action: Mersey Tunnel Bill to be repealed so that its provisions no longer apply.
attributes.background: The provision of the Bill has a negative effect on the economy of the North West of England.
